page.title: 15Weston Manor
page.content:
Though most of the present building dates from the 16th century a manor house has stood on this site since the early medieval period. Once a private family residence, Weston Manor is now a thriving country hotel.
The{hotel}has 23 bedrooms and a licensed restaurant. It is a popular calling place for{foreign tourists and hosts numerous conferences and wedding receptions. Most of its staff of 50 are local people. The present owners are undertaking a sympathetic restoration programme which also provides work for local craftsmen.
Steeped in Civil War history, the Manor has 3{ghost legends:}Mad Maude, a profligate nun burned at the stake, a dairymaid who fell to her death from the Tower and a phantom coach.
